author: robocopsgonemad
content: anyone know of a kurtosis config that has a bit more at the application layer? lets say I wanted to spin up a dummy network that also had a couple apps on it, like uniswap or ens and all the corresponding UIs

author: robocopsgonemad
content: bonus points if it includes some basic mev searching and block building

author: robocopsgonemad
content: also - not married to kurtosis, if there is some other devops tool for spinning up a whole ecosystem, awesome

author: robocopsgonemad
content: so a kurtosis enclave, an ethpandaops tooling stack, deployment of app contracts and the corresponding UIs, an automated mev searcher, mev boost relays and buliders

author: parithosh
content:
enable spamoor, setup the uniswap-swaps scenario, enable mev_type: flashbots,  profit??

https://github.com/ethpandaops/spamoor

author: parithosh
content: and if there are more apps you'd like, add them as scenarios or to the same one. The tool is agnostic to the app

author: parithosh
content: and spamoor already works in kurtosis

author: robocopsgonemad
content: so maybe all i'd need to do is implement a frontrunner that works with the uniswap-swaps scenario?

author: robocopsgonemad
content: it's the "searching through the mempool" part that I need to make sure is being exercised, is spamoor the right tool for that?

author: parithosh
content:
Yeah so spamoor will toss the txs in the mempool, you would have API access to the mempool, you can then configure your frontrunner to read the mempool and do whatever you need it to do. Does that sound like what you'd want? 

also you could use the port_publisher feature to make sure the ports are open to the entire localhost

author: robocopsgonemad
content: yes, it does sound like what i want. now i just need to find a frontrunner i don't need to write, thx
